intro: Ophiorrhiza nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It typically grows on the branches of host trees, deriving some of its nutrients from the host while also performing photosynthesis. The plant has small, ovate leaves and produces small, white flowers that are often clustered together. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains one or two seeds. Ophiorrhiza nelsonii is found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments.
